What is SaltStack?

SaltStack is a new approach to infrastructure management. SaltStack is simple enough to get running in minutes, scalable enough to manage tens of thousands of servers, and fast enough to communicate with them in seconds.

Learn more at saltstack.com.

We Love All of You

Or at least all of your management approaches. When enthusiasts talk about the 'best' management approach, they are usually right about a particular approach being the best for their needs. But what about your needs?

SaltStack is focused on creating the best set of management tools available anywhere, and then providing as many ways as we can think of to let you use them. No agent? No server? No problem.

This quick start guide walks you through the basic steps to get SaltStack up and running. You'll learn how to:

  • Install SaltStack
  • Remotely execute commands
  • Manage software and system configurations

Before we start, we've included a few things we think you should know about SaltStack's flexible approach to management. (If this doesn't interest you, feel free to jump straight into the guide.)

SaltStack Flexibility

Every management tool and their Git forks claim to be flexible, but when we say flexible at SaltStack, we mean entire-management-approach flexible.

SaltStack can be configured to follow a variety of systems management models:

  • Agent and Server
  • Agent-only
  • Server-only
  • Any or all of the above together

Agent and Server

The standard model for configuration management. A management server sends commands and configurations to agents running on large numbers of systems, and results are returned to the server.

Agent-only

If you have avoided management tools because you don't want to set up all of that "extra stuff", this is likely the model for you. Salt agents can perform management tasks with or without the involvement of a server.

The best thing about this model is that it is already built-in; if you don't want to use a management server, you simply don't set one up. You can move back and forth between this model and the Agent and Server model, or use them both together.

Server-only

Salt commands can be executed on remote systems using SSH instead of the Salt agent. Configure all of your web servers using the Salt agent, but perform ad hoc management tasks on your database servers over SSH. It is completely up to you.

No Size Fits All

In this guide, multiple approaches are often presented to perform the same task. These different approaches are presented together because they can be used together. When you see a tab titled "Agent and Server", "Agent-only", or "Server-only", it shows how to use SaltStack with each management approach.

Now on with the guide.
